TITLE: Many 'doubted the vision': Saudi investment minister touts 'green shoring' on path to diversification
SUMMARY: Saudi Minister of Investment Khalid al-Falih pushed back on skepticism of Riyadh's economic diversification.

TITLE: Europe's economy survived 'terrible prophecies' but must now tackle trade with China: EU's Gentiloni
SUMMARY: After surviving the "terrible prophecies," Europe's economy must face the challenges of the war in Ukraine and trade ties with China, EU's Paolo Gentiloni says.

TITLE: Unemployment among Black workers falls in August, bucking trend from other groups
SUMMARY: The unemployment rate for Black workers crept lower in August.

TITLE: Fed Governor Waller backs interest rate cut at September meeting, open to larger move
SUMMARY: Waller on Friday backed an interest rate cut at the upcoming policy meeting, noting the importance of supporting a weakening jobs picture.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for August 2024 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Health care and hospitality were key drivers for a job market that has cooled off in recent months.

TITLE: August payrolls grew by a less-than-expected 142,000, but unemployment rate ticked down to 4.2%
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to expand by 161,000 in August while the unemployment rate fell to 4.2%.

TITLE: Friday's jobs report for August is going to be huge. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: The Wall Street consensus is for nonfarm payrolls growth of 161,000 for August and a slight decline in the unemployment rate to 4.2%.

TITLE: August private payrolls rose by 99,000, smallest gain since 2021 and far below estimates, ADP says
SUMMARY: The total was less than the downwardly revised 111,000 in July and below the Dow Jones consensus forecast for 140,000.

TITLE: Layoffs jump in August while hiring in 2024 is at a historic low, Challenger report shows
SUMMARY: Announced job cuts totaled 75,891 for the month, lurching 193% higher than July.

TITLE: Bond market 'yield curve' returns to normal from inverted state that had raised recession fears
SUMMARY: The relationship between the 10- and 2-year Treasury yield briefly normalized Wednesday, reversing a classic recession indicator.

TITLE: Job openings fell more than expected in July in another sign of labor market softening
SUMMARY: The closely watched Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey showed that available positions fell to 7.67 million on the month.

TITLE: Atlanta Fed President Bostic says officials can't wait for inflation to hit 2% before cutting
SUMMARY: Bostic signaled that he is ready to start lowering rates even though inflation is still running above the Fed's target.

TITLE: Weak manufacturing measures raise specter of U.S. economic slowdown
SUMMARY: The ISM monthly survey of purchasing managers showed that just 47.2% reported expansion in August.

TITLE: The Fed’s favorite inflation indicator increased 0.2% in July, as expected
SUMMARY: The PCE price index was expected to rise 0.2% in July and 2.5% from a year ago, according to the Dow Jones consensus.

TITLE: Euro zone inflation falls to 3-year low of 2.2%, backing September rate cut case
SUMMARY: Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a decline to 2.2% in August, down from 2.6% in July.

TITLE: The Fed's preferred inflation indicator is out Friday. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: The Commerce Department at 8:30 a.m. ET will release its personal consumption expenditures price index.

TITLE: Increased sausage demand could be worrying signal on the economy
SUMMARY: One manufacturer included in the Dallas Fed's latest survey said growth in the category typically aligns with a slowing economy.

TITLE: No longer a financial reservoir? Saudi Arabia’s spending confirms clear shift in strategy
SUMMARY: The kingdom's $925 billion sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund, saw its assets jump 29% in 2023 — and domestic investment was a major driver.

TITLE: A recession is coming in the U.S., and 'a few rate cuts' won't prevent it, says strategist
SUMMARY: Contrary to what many believe, investment research firm BCA Research sees that the economy is on the cusp of a recession.

TITLE: U.S. job growth revised down by the most since 2009. Why this time is different
SUMMARY: There's a lot of debate about how much signal to take from the 818,000 downward revisions to U.S. payrolls — the largest since 2009. Is it signaling recession?

TITLE: Nonfarm payroll growth revised down by 818,000, Labor Department says
SUMMARY: The U.S. economy created far fewer jobs than originally reported in the 12-month period through March 2024, the Labor Department reported.

TITLE: Fed survey shows lows in employment, worries about finding work and dissatisfaction with pay
SUMMARY: The survey showed a slide in people reporting they are employed, a surge in those looking for work and growing dissatisfaction with pay.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs cuts odds of U.S. recession to 20% after retail and jobs data
SUMMARY: "Continued expansion would make the US look more similar to other G10 economies, where the Sahm rule has held less than 70% of the time," economists said.

TITLE: Egg prices are rising once again as bird flu limits supply
SUMMARY: Egg prices jumped more than 19% in July compared with the same month a year ago, consumer price index data shows.

TITLE: Consumer spending jumped in July as retail sales were up 1%, much better than expected
SUMMARY: Retail sales were projected to increase 0.3% in July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

TITLE: UK economy expands 0.6% in second quarter; June growth stalls
SUMMARY: GDP has recorded slight but steady growth almost every month so far this year as the U.K. exits a shallow recession.

TITLE: Annual inflation rate slows to 2.9% in July, lowest since 2021
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to show a 0.2% increase in July and a 3% gain over the past year.

TITLE: Wednesday's big CPI inflation report could mark a change in thinking for the Fed
SUMMARY: The news Tuesday was good for inflation, and investors hope it will get even better Wednesday.

TITLE: Wholesale inflation measure rose 0.1% in July, less than expected
SUMMARY: The producer price index for July was expected to increase 0.2%, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

TITLE: Three-year inflation outlook hits record low in New York Fed consumer survey
SUMMARY: Consumers grew more confident in July that inflation will be less of a problem in the coming years.
